laboratory_examinations.findings: CD4 T lymphocytopenia with counts of 250 cells/mm³, which is below the normal range (<300 cells/mm³ and <20% of lymphocytes).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Before interferon treatment, the CD4 T lymphocyte count was found to be reduced twice. During interferon treatment, CD8 T lymphocyte counts and the size of the CD8+/CD57+ fraction declined gradually, while there was no significant change in T-cell subsets.

laboratory_examinations.findings: All routine blood test results were normal.
